section.title: CentOS Studio Overview
section.para: CentOS Studio provides a standard platform to configure, test, deploy and maintain systems and applications based on CentOS and Red Hat Enterprise Linux. CentOS Studio assembles software, configuration and, optionally, installation images, into a standard deployment format, called a repository. Repositories can be used to test, install and maintain client machines across a wide range of IT environments - including physical, virtual and cloud.
Using CentOS Studio you can create and maintain repositories:

listitem.para: select input repositories including a base operating system repository and additional package repositories,
select packages and groups to include,

section.para: CentOS Studio reads a repository definition, gathers input (installation images, software packages, and configuration files), and creates a repository. Using the repository, you can test, deploy and update client machines.

In summary, CentOS Studio is a production life cycle manager for use in defining, building, testing, deploying and maintaining repositories that can be easily installed and updated in a wide variety of IT environments.
